result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven L Schwartz was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, DNA surcharge and blood draw fee.  Balance to be paid at $50 per month commencing 07-01-2017 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 25 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Pewaukee Police Department.

FIRST 200 DAYS to be served through Huber with standard release conditions, COMMENCING FORTHWITH.
Balance to be served through the Day Report Program.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.
Good time credit applies to all 350 days.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant has completed a Victim Impact Panel.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven L Schwartz in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
350 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Forthwith.
4 Days Credit.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Good time credit applies to all 350 days.
First 200 days to be served through huber - Balance to be served through the day report program.
 
FINE: $ 2,048
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Pewaukee Police Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 07/01/17 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  25 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Forthwith.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION:
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK:

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  Already Completed.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on September 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steven L Schwartz in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  
Oral Ruling On:
Defendant Motion - Challenging the OWI 2nd Conviction.


Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the defense has made a prima facia showing.
Court also finds there is an absence to confirm what occurred in court (matter was over 16 years old and no transcript was ever prepared - and no ability to to have a transcript prepared due to the fact that court reporters are only required to keep their notes for 10 years.).
Court finds the Plea Questionnaire by it's self is not sufficient to verify what took place in court.
Therefore, Court Grants the Defense Motion to Challenge the OWI 2nd Conviction.
The State will not be able to use the OWI (2nd) as a prior conviction.
This matter now becomes a misdemeanor.
State to file an amended information making this matter an OWI (4th) with 2 weeks.

  Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven L Schwartz in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant stated he was let go from his employer and will be going back to the Public Defender's Office.  Hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 01-04-2016 10:00 am

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and maintaining absolute sobriety and on the SCRAM monitor.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Steven L Schwartz in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cameron Weitzner appears as friend of the court.
